column4: alright, I'm on a live session now because I can no longer boot into ubuntu at all
who's willing to help me out?
post what you're having troubles with and whoever knows will answer
might be a misconfiguration in the xorg.conf
this i know... which is why i hate having to answer the question that way... lemme send you some more error messages it comes up with
the xorg error log is at /var/log/Xorg.0.log.
it reports no errors, which is one of the many many reason's im pretty sure it's not an xorg.conf problem
looks like there is a formatting problem on your blacklist file
i've blacklisted ubuntu's default driver for my webcam is all... it didn't have any effect on booting for a good two weeks or so
try removing the offending line and booting again... ?
or, better yet, commenting it out
that's probably what I would try anyway, other than that you'd have to ask someone else with more knowledge about the system =P
that's only a warning so it shouldn't be a problem
coincindentally... it's no longer on my /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist i wonder where it went? clearly it must still be there
beyond that I haven't a clue
